thread.title: Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6
thread.title_full: Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6

author: DAVE SKRETTA
title: Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6
text:
Jae C. Hong Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 
Kansas City Royals' Lorenzo Cain celebrates after scoring on a hit by Eric Hosmer past Toronto Blue Jays catcher Russell Martin during the eight inning in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Charlie Riedel Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 
Kansas City Royals' Lorenzo Cain is safe at home past Toronto Blue Jays catcher Russell Martin on a hit by Eric Hosmer during the eight inning in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Matt Slocum Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 
Kansas City Royals' Lorenzo Cain celebrates after scoring on a hit by Eric Hosmer against the Toronto Blue Jays during the eight inning in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum) Matt Slocum Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 
Kansas City Royals' Lorenzo Cain celebrates after scoring on a hit by Eric Hosmer against the Toronto Blue Jays during the eight inning in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum) Jae C. Hong Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 
Toronto Blue Jays' Jose Bautista watches his solo home run against the Kansas City Royals during the fourth inning in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Posted: Friday, October 23, 2015 9:28 pm Royals return to World Series, beat Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 Associated Press | 
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) â€” Lorenzo Cain sprinted home from first base on Eric Hosmer's single in the eighth inning, Wade Davis weathered a 45-minute rain delay and a white-knuckle ninth, and the Kansas City Royals beat the Toronto Blue Jays 4-3 Friday night to earn their second straight trip to the World Series. 
The victory in Game 6 of the AL Championship Series sent the Royals into the World Series, starting Tuesday night at home against the New York Mets.
